intro: Adenogramma oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaved adenogramma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
